title: Ascension selling off two hospitals
text:
RSS St. Louis Business Journal , July 2, 2015 
A national health care organization headquartered in St. Louis County is selling off a pair of its hospitals, in Idaho and Washington. Ascension signed a letter of intent this week calling for Capella Healthcare of Franklin, Tennessee, to acquire Lourdes Health Network in Pasco, Washington, and St. Joseph Regional Medical Center in Lewiston, Idaho. Terms of the deal were not disclosed. "Capella Healthcare already has a presence in the Pacific Northwest, and we're confident that this change in ownership would give Lourdes and St. Joseph the ability to serve the Pasco and Lewiston communities well into the future," Robert Henkel, executive vice president of Ascension and president and CEO of Ascension Health, said in a statement.
